p: Our results clearly indicated that the extraction of phenolic compounds and their antioxidant capacity is highly dependent on the solvent of extraction. The study also revealed that H. arborescens aqueous, blanched and ethanol leaf extracts possess various levels and concentrations of phytochemical constituents, which may be essential for human health. A positive correlation between polyphenolic contents, antioxidant and antibacterial activities in extracts of H. arborescens leaves was established, which indicates that certain phenolic compounds may be responsible for high antioxidant activity. It was also observed that the blanching process (at 80 0 C) significantly decreased polyphenolic content and antioxidant activities but increased antibacterial activity of H. arborescens leaves. This study therefore agrees with its reported use in traditional medicine for the treatment of some bacterial infections and diseases.
